label: lem-empirical-aggregator-properties
name: Axiomatic Properties of the Empirical Measure Aggregator

relations_established.label: rel-empirical-aggregator-is-valid-swarm-aggregator
relations_established.description: The empirical measure M(S,v) = (1/k) sum delta_vi is a valid instantiation of the axiomatic Swarm Aggregation Operator

relations_established.label: rel-empirical-aggregator-value-lipschitz-mean
relations_established.description: Value Lipschitz constant for mean scales as inverse square root of alive set size

relations_established.label: rel-empirical-aggregator-value-lipschitz-m2
relations_established.description: Value Lipschitz constant for second moment bounded by 2V_max k^{-1/2}

relations_established.label: rel-empirical-aggregator-structural-lipschitz-mean
relations_established.description: Structural continuity constant for mean inversely proportional to target alive set size

relations_established.label: rel-empirical-aggregator-structural-lipschitz-m2
relations_established.description: Structural continuity constant for second moment with V_max^2 scaling

relations_established.label: rel-empirical-aggregator-variance-deviation-factor
relations_established.description: Variance deviation factor is exactly 1 for empirical aggregator (identity)

relations_established.label: rel-empirical-aggregator-range-variance-factor
relations_established.description: Range-to-variance factor is exactly 1 for empirical aggregator

relations_established.label: rel-empirical-aggregator-structural-growth-exponents
relations_established.description: Structural continuity improves linearly with alive set size (exponent -1)

natural_language_statement: Let the aggregation operator M be defined such that for any swarm state S with alive set A(S) of size k = |A(S)| >= 1, and any raw value vector v, it produces the discrete empirical measure: M(S, v) = (1/k) sum_{i in A(S)} delta_{v_i}. This operator is a valid Swarm Aggregation Operator. Assuming the raw values are bounded by |v_i| <= V_max, its moment functions, continuity functions, and axiomatic parameters satisfy specific bounds and properties.
assumptions: Raw values bounded: |v_i| <= V_max for all i
Bounded relative collapse holds: k_2 >= c_min * k_1 for axiom verification
conclusion: The empirical measure aggregator satisfies all axiomatic requirements of def-swarm-aggregation-operator-axiomatic with explicit Lipschitz constants and growth exponents: (1) Value Lipschitz constants scale as k^{-1/2}, (2) Structural Lipschitz constants scale as k_2^{-1}, (3) Variance deviation and range factors both equal 1, (4) Structural growth exponents all equal -1.
full_statement_text: Let the aggregation operator M be defined such that for any swarm state S with alive set A(S) of size k = |A(S)| >= 1, and any raw value vector v, it produces the discrete empirical measure: M(S, v) = (1/k) sum_{i in A(S)} delta_{v_i}. This operator is a valid Swarm Aggregation Operator. Assuming the raw values are bounded by |v_i| <= V_max, its moment functions, continuity functions, and axiomatic parameters satisfy specific bounds and properties.
